meanings.definition: The act of departing quickly or secretly.
meanings.sent1: The decampment of the soldiers caught the enemy off guard.
meanings.sent2: The decampment from the party was so swift that no one noticed.
meanings.sent3: The decampment of the squirrels from the bird feeder was quite the spectacle.
meanings.sent4: Her decampment from the meeting left everyone wondering about her sudden exit.
meanings.sent5: The decampment of the students after the final bell rang was like a stampede.

meanings.definition: The act of leaving a place suddenly or hurriedly.
meanings.sent1: The sudden decampment of the guests surprised the host.
meanings.sent2: His decampment from the room was so quick that he forgot his keys.
meanings.sent3: The decampment of the cat from the room was comical as it knocked over a vase.
meanings.sent4: The decampment of the storm clouds brought a clear sky.
meanings.sent5: The decampment of the students from the classroom was like a race to the door.
